Class Map

  • java.lang.Object
    • Map

  • public class Map
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that contains all of the obstacles that the player sees and has to avoid.
    Author:
    Patrick Thomas

    • Constructor Detail

      • Map

        public Map(int screensize_x,
           int screensize_y,
           double scroll_speed)
        Constructor for the map. Scroll speed will be designed to change based on the speed that the hand glider is travelling at. Physics will be used to calculate speeds and such, and the (somewhat unconserved) kinetic energy will be used to calculate the speed after dives and such. The x-component of the speed is then used as the scroll speed.
        Parameters:
        screensize_x - The width of the applet
        screensize_y - The height of the applet
        scroll_speed - The intial speed of the hang glider

    • Method Detail

      • tick

        public void tick(int a_width,
                 int a_height,
                 TestGlider hg,
                 double scroll_speed)
        This is to update the map with time. The map is updated per tick, along with screen refreshes. Thus, the rate that the map is updated is tied in with FPS. This is supposed to be ran every update of the screen/when the rest of the game ticks. Every tick, the map's objects are scrolled in relation with the hang glider. This is also designed to hook in with the events class, so timed events can happen per amount of ticks or check a condition every set amount of ticks.
        Parameters:
        a_width - The width of the applet
        a_height - The height of the applet
        hg - The TestGlider object

      • draw

        public void draw(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draw the map's objects (obstacles and coins) onto the given graphics object.
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics object to draw to applet
